summary: Las Vegas is often invoked in discussions of Michael Jackson as the epicenter of commercial tributes and impersonator culture (e.g., Cirque du Soleil’s Michael Jackson ONE), used to illustrate how his image has been repackaged into tourist spectacle. summary: YouTube amplifies competing narratives about Michael Jackson by circulating his music videos, rare performances and fan tributes that reinforce his artistic legacy while also hosting documentaries, leaked trial clips and abuse allegations (e.g., Leaving Neverland) that critics use to challenge his reputation. summary: Saturday Night Live frequently uses impersonation and satire to package Michael Jackson for mass audiences, reinforcing views of him as an eccentric pop genius or a larger-than-life celebrity while also lampooning the controversies that swirled around him.
